lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Next up this weekend we're all going to be at New York Comic Con, which is going to be awesome. We have a two hour block from noon to 2:00 PM Saturday, October 12th. Where is it at? What's the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a weird word, the Winga Stage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will be from 2:30 to 4:30. Our time block shifted a little later in the day. 2:30 to 4:30, Forbidden Planet, we'll be there. We'll be signing autographs, meeting you guys, chatting it up, and we'll be debuting our brand new awesome poster here, exclusively for the New York Comic Con. Our Critical Role poster! We're super excited about it. This was wonderfully designed by one of our fellow Critters Joma Cueto. Joma did the art and Kim Davis did the actual layout and design. Both did an amazing job. We're going to have a bunch of these available. We'll be signing them for you guys, and we'll hope to see you there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They are pretty sexy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going to be on the Wikia stage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go read them if you have the chance, if you haven't yet. Or wait until after the show. Also, as of today we now have in the Geek and Sundry store Critical Role key chains and necklaces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They look so cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty rad. I'm really excited. They're metal and awesome. They're of our logo and if you feel like being as nerdy as we are and want to adorn your key chains with them, they are there available for your purchase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're custom order, so they make them when you order them. It takes a few weeks to get them once you order them, but it's worth it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They have to come all the way from Kraghammer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the last week you can buy the #NoShaveTil10k shirts. We have people who are keeping it up. I had to shave for Vin Diesel, but the rest of the month is straight on this now, largely for my Halloween costume and for this wonderful event. 20% of all proceeds from those shirts goes to the Extra Life charity we've been supporting, it helps out good people.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: I drew that shirt, by the way. I had to look at his face for 12 hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We've already hit 9,100. Protocol95, you are the first winner of the night!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Protocol95, congratulations. You will be winning the first bundle. Every 100 subscribers there will be another giveaway within the chat room. You have to be active in the chat to be up for it. It includes a cast photo signed by the cast of Critical Role, possibly signed while he's wearing that awesome beard. And a wonderful piece of art from our main artist Kit Buss, also signed by the cast of Critical Role. So every 100 subscribers, that giveaway goes out in the chatroom. Be active and bring your friends on to subscribe so you can win one. Last thing I want to mention, this has been a question that's come up quite a bit, some people are definitely eager to hear the information, so I had the pleasure on Monday this week of designing and running a very quick game of Dungeons and Dragons for Vin Diesel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's just cross that bucket list item off immediately. That was ridiculous. So it was a lot of fun. He was fantastic, super awesome, genuine, and was really excited--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He rolled this die. It's sacred.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was literally bucket list! That was one of the things we discussed when this game started; it could lead to a game with Vin Diesel.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet if you go back and look at the Q and A session we had, someone asked our dream game crew--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vin Diesel was one of our bucket list players. So we've already knocked one off on the show.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a group mass suicide at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Get matching tennis shoes, and it'll be great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You didn't seem that excited, though.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We can already announce that next Thursday at the midpoint--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next Thursday at the midpoint of next week's Critical Role, we are going to show a mostly complete video of that game. The full one will be released shortly thereafter, but next week, on Critical Role during the midpoint, we're going to show you the majority of that game session with him. Don't miss that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I get a teaser? What did he smell like?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Iron.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quarry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Muscle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Antifreeze and lilac.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of those answers at once. A majestic scent. It was delightful. We'll have interviews going up throughout the week, exclusively next week here on Thursday you'll be seeing most of that game here and then more stuff's coming out for the week thereafter. Really excited about that, and I custom-made a witchhunter class for him that I tailored for that level, and there's been such a wide response for everyone asking about the class that I've now spent a lot of my free time that I'm not preparing for this game now customizing a homebrew witchhunter class for all of you to partake in. So that'll be fun and probably coming out sometime next week. It'll probably be broken. You're welcome to homebrew my homebrew, I'm not perfect, but it should be fun and a cool guide for some people to give it a shot as a player class, so look forward to that. Liam, you got a couple things to announce?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But Joe told me that they saw a little bit of a bump every Thursday, and that our roleplaying power had some effect, so thank you guys, thank you very much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because we are many.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are legion.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The other thing is tomorrow is Sam Riegel's birthday.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nipples, is it really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something I commissioned the lovely Kit Buss to make for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? It's Vaxmas?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's Vaxmas. Here it is. I'm going to send it across and then I'll tweet it out. You guys can look, but I made this just for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not looking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I made this just for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow, that's really nice! I thought it was going to be vulgar. Wow. That's so sweet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kit Buss, why are you the best?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Kit Buss. Me and two ladies, what could be better? Right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess three ladies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how to put this up, but thank you. That's so sweet. Aw. I won't kill you tonight.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Fun fact: Sam shares a birthday with my mom. That's why I'll never forget your birthday, ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And John Lennon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Happy birthday, Orion's mom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Happy birthday, Sam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Happy unbirthday to Sam's mom, who is also a Critter. You should go follow her on Twitter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Momlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's not effing around, either.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any other announcements? Or shall we dive in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have one. I got nominated for a Golden Joystick award.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, for Fiona in Tales from the Borderlands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's awesome! (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey Travis, you didn't know this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't tell him. I think there's a week left of voting, so you can go and help out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: They can vote for you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, they can vote for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can they vote many times?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think you have to register your email address, so I don't know how many times you can vote, but you have to vote in all the categories in order to vote for the one category.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Congratulations, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, baby!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As Orion says, release the Critters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swept her away. The rest of the party, Tiberius enabled to fly through arcane means, and thus we had a squadron of evening cows chasing after the roc, which then got turned into a cow, to crash into a mountain. They chased it back to its perch up in the Cliffside Mountains to the northwest of Emon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Such an old trope in fantasy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After some rather roundabout and at some points on-the-edge-of-conflict conversation, they managed to convince him to instead take the bird and flee across the Ozmit Sea, to the northwest, towards Vasselheim, where it would be a much better landscape for the creature to thrive and grow. After that, the party is making their way back. Right around the beginning of daybreak, towards the keep. So that is where we left off. Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes? Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Make the world right. My gift is yours, and your gift shall bring justice. Our bargain stands eager "to close." You suddenly come to consciousness, gasping loudly against the air. You feel the warmth of the forge across the side of the workshop crawling across your face. You are sitting at your workbench, having fallen asleep amidst a pile of contraptions in mid-construction. As you look around, you can see your leather gloves are still on, apron on, blackened soot spread across your face, and a series of things you were in mid-build on broken before you on your workshop table.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) How long have I been here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's nobody in the room, and you have no idea. You're underground in the workshop. You haven't seen the sun probably for a good day and a half.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's a new day. I didn't waste it at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea quite how long you've been down here, and you've been left alone for quite some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to head upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and open the metallic door that leads into your workshop and come around the corner, and there's a chair set in the corner, where Jarett would be sitting, one of the head guards at your facility. Jarett, however, is standing, hands up to his throat, going (choking sounds) with no visible assailant.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (shouting) Help!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we there? No, we're not even there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want you to go ahead and roll initiative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, it's already started!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket was down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say that!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just saying that Trinket died already.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's how Percy does it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is with that dice and you, man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are the yin to Wil Wheaton's yang.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He was sitting here 20 minutes ago. I rubbed him for luck when he was leaving the building.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we have him. It's balance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what's your total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. (laughs) You are definitely-- Okay. You are up first. What do you want to do? As you come around the corner and you see this visual in front of you. If you want to go ahead and roll for Trinket, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (worried noises) Oh no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I just see him up like this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for some reference, does it look like he's possessed, or does it look like he's trying to remove something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like he's trying to remove something from around his neck, and looking down, you can see his feet are actually off the ground, kicking. It looks like there's a little bit of air wisping around behind him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How insane would it be to try and make a shot beneath his legs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly go for it and try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to drop down. Can I make an aimed shot against something I can't see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try, it'll be with disadvantage, but you can definitely make it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's in the kitchen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's downstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I request that the rest of us do the sounds of the ricocheting bullets in case he misses?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I want 5.1; start here and make it all the way down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you're not going to miss, so it doesn't matter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take an aimed shot for my first shot, and then start firing blindly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This will be disadvantage against an invisible assailant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It misses?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It missed. I'm just making sure I didn't misfire. No, I didn't! Thank god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 15? Still hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Still hits? 15 hits? Oh, that's 16 points of damage, and he has to make a constitution saving throw to not be knocked prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What's the DC on that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where is my DC? DC of eight plus my proficiency mod, plus my dexterity mod, so 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure enough. You see all of a sudden the air go (gasp) and Jaret falls to his knees (coughs).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take two more shots right above his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't hit Jarett.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jarett's on his knees, prone, essentially.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He could still hit Jarett! He's our best guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have disadvantage on these.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you still have disadvantage on these. It is still an invisible creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 does not hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then 20 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of damage. (gunshots) The gunshots are echoing through the hallway. Whatever this weird entity is, you can see some of the nearby cloth and dust swirl up from its movement, you hear this (gasping sound), this angry sucking sound in the air around you. Do you want to move, or are you staying where you are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stay where I am. And I'm going to keep yelling. Help! I don't think I have an earring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see some sort of shimmer of wind come around the corner towards you. This one turns around and (whooshing sound) over to the bars, and you can see in the distance, it's moving over towards where your captive currently is.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How far away are we from the keep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm getting to that. At the end of this combat round, all of you guys are right toward the outskirts of the keep, and you hear the muffled ringing of gunshots from the inside of the keep.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We do hear that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do hear this as you're just getting to the outer gates.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As soon as I hear that, I cast Fly on myself and (whoosh).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you wearing an earring, Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he is not. The entity swooshes down the stairs and comes at you. That's going to be a 22.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a 12.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That does not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It swings towards you, and a giant slam of extremely condensed air with a raking claw impact hits you in the torso, doing 15 points of bludgeoning damage. The other one swings out, same direction. This time you actually pull off to the side and knock it out of the way with your Pepperbox. The one back there is going to attempt to grapple. Succeeds. That's its action, and you can see the driver that you had put into prison is currently being (choking) making strangling sounds in the distance. That ends it. Trinket's up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket. He can see Percy getting attacked and instinct takes over, and he runs forward and he claws him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll for the attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That does not hit. That's a natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will hit! (laughs) It begins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's the wrong thing. That's a 2d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So roll 2d4 and then multiply those by two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 damage, nice. Trinket runs up, coming out of his somewhat sleepy stupor, goes for a bite attack and grabs nothing with it, and turns around and rakes a claw backwards, manages to get the back of whatever this entity is, and you hear it scream (gasping scream). You do, at least.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a technical dispute, really quickly. Could the wraith have gotten that far, since I knocked him prone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it could've, because it uses half its movement speed to get up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, thank you. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its movement is actually 50.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ignore me! 50?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not that you know that. But it moved far for what you think it should've been able to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: By the way, for the record, Matthew, I have no idea what we're fighting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody does.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just saying, I haven't meta-gamed here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congrats. (laughs) I'm proud of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fresh start.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jarett then gets up, sees this happening, moves over, and pulls out the key to try and open the prison door. Spends the turn doing so. Manages to get the door open. That's the end of Jarett's turn. Okay, now, the rest of you guys roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that count, if I hit it into my box and it slammed into the side? Does that count, or should I let it roll naturally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let it roll naturally. That would normally count, but it's fine. Wherever it lands, you take it, going forward. Okay, so 25 to 20?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, initiative?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keep up, people! Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the gunshot. You're entering this intensity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think it's anything. I think it's just him tinkering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Scanlan stays behind. 25 to 20? 20 to 15? What are your scores?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you all, by the way, for leaving a bear on suicide watch. That was really cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, what'd you get again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got 17.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He got 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, Tiberius. And what'd you get, Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, all right. Three 15s.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) There's no way I can fire at the one who's far away from me right now, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But Jarett's got him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can ignore cover, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can ignore cover, but you have this entity in front of you. I mean, you'll be at disadvantage regardless, because you're shooting at something invisible, and you have something that's in melee of you and you have a ranged weapon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to see if there's a charge left in my glove and try and take the-- there wouldn't be a charge left in my glove, would there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance down at the glove, and you see the gemstone in the center of the palm is currently dark and lifeless.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. (sighs) Hold on, sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fan the hammer, motherfuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's see what we do. All right. There's no way I can step back right now, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll get a free strike on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to try and take shots, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage on each shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, that's a misfire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Pepperbox (explosion sound). You go to shoot, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (ricochet sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barrel gets clogged, and the front of it actually catches fire for a second, and you have to shake it out right now. It's completely offset, and it's going to take a moment to even get it to where you can fire again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Do I have six seconds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. And you've used one attack. You have two more attacks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it misfired.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that weapon you have to use an action to repair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to do something a little weird. I'm going to pull out Bad News. I know I can't shoot this close with it, or god only knows what would happen. I'm going to try and swing it like a pugil stick, and I'm going to try and hit him with the butt of Bad News.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a melee attack. This is strength-based. Add your proficiency modifier and your strength modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have disadvantage on it because you can't see it. And you're not proficient.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so go ahead and roll-- with the size of Bad News, I'd say 1d6, plus your strength modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever entity you smacked gets pushed against the wall. Go ahead and roll a d20 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the impact does not appear to damage Bad News in this instance. It is a fragile construct, and even doing melee attacks with it does subject it to a misfire possibility.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hit it with the stock, I was careful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Okay, so that concludes your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm kind of-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you stay there. All right. The one that's in front of you now is going to go ahead and go over this way. Trinket-- well, no, it's still in melee, so it doesn't actually get an attack. It does get two strikes on you. That is a 17.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that is 18.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Armor class is 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it does just hit you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I do that crazy thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I've eliminated that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, you've removed that. Okay, never mind. I don't have the new update, sorry. I don't have a dodge anymore, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the dodge is not there. It rarely came into play. Okay, so that puts you at another 15 points of bludgeoning damage as it just smacks you right across the head. Your eyes go dizzy for a second, and you take a minute to refocus your vision, and you can now see in the air, the shimmering expression that looks like a humanoid face stretched and ghastly going (gasps) in front of you, but it's still barely even visible, and only because of the proximity to you are you able to actually make out any sort of shape or shimmer in the air in front of you. The other one is attempting to choke out the prisoner. However, the prisoner resists through athletics, so he's currently holding back at bay the strength of the entity. That ends its turn. Trinket's up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's up! He's going to try to jump and land on top of the ghostly thing and bite its face. I don't know how to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 18 to hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm having an issue here. Because I have 18 in parentheses, and then I wrote a 20 and I circled it and I don't know why.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know why, either.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 18 is probably--

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: Its slamming its back into the bars. It's right there in front of you, and you use that instance to go ahead and reach through the bars, grab it by the throat, and stab it repeatedly, at which point its form disperses into wind around you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I slap Grog on the back and say, you softened the shit of him. That's terrible English. You softened him up for me! Asshole.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've been drinking?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (giggling) You softened the shit of him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You shitted him up for me, Grog. Good job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys look over. You see Desmond is still on the bed, eyes wide (panting).

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I rush over to Desmond, and out of my pouch I bring out a sandwich that I had made earlier. I hand it to him and I go, Desmond, decker. Here, have it. It's a decker sandwich. You should have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gets up on the bed and takes it. "What happened?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run up and I cast Cure Wounds on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So go ahead and roll for the Cure Wounds heal on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You casting that all over the place now aren't you, fancy-pants?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From the tinkering room I yell out, is it safe? Can I come out now?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's four more of them. Stay back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Okay. I'll stay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I remember I have the holy oil in my hand, mixed with the blood, and I start blessing him. With bloody fist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I add my wisdom to that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then it's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's good to know. All right, cool. All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How's that sandwich?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Desmond isn't eating it. He's just holding it and still taking in. "What happened? What was "that?! Look, what was that thing?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, what was that thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that thing?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I would say opaque buttholes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we do a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll make an arcana check, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did you get two?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I rolled one by accident.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you rolled by accident, you have to roll intentionally to take the score. Because if you were to accidentally roll really bad, you'd be like, "That doesn't count! I didn't actually "roll."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A hard 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 12?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 22 arcana check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he's faced these things before. That's what it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're used as assassins that have a very sole, single-minded purpose.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All I know is they feel like the Briarwoods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get that, based on recent events, there's probably a good probability that was the source of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know from your previous experience if there's any way to protect against them? Other than setting up walls?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, all I know is how to stick my face in the beehives, apparently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody know how to protect against air stalkers?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Give me a day, I will find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jarett, at which point has put his hand against the wall, and goes, "Ugh. I would "recommend that next time you decide to put me on watch, let me know if we're up against things that "are invisible. I apologize. I was not prepared for such a foe to show up."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We were unprepared to warn you. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right. If I might ask, what exactly are we up against here?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck if we know.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Seems like we're up against either vampires or liches. Prepare the troops. There will be some changes made to the keep over the next couple of days. We shall shore up security, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would like also to consider possibly some changes made to our income, as this suddenly "turned from a general guarding job to going up against the denizens of the afterlife. It's "already been a very dangerous proposition."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Of course. We shall discuss that in the-- is it the morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I'm going to go ahead and make sure the rest of my team is alive."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jarett! Are you up for it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If the pay is good, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jarett's up for anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You understand. Ugh, okay. Talk to you in the morning. I think a bit of rest is necessary." And he makes his way up the stairs to the rest of the keep. Desmond at this point is still in shock, and he starts absentmindedly eating the sandwich that you handed him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's good, right? I had one yesterday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. Maybe it's best not to leave him down here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Come.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is it safer there?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I told you they'd come for me. I told you they would."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you know what! You're still alive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've had the worst couple of days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wipes the blood from the side of his face and looks at it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Let's take you upstairs and get you all fitted... Who do we talk to that works for us that does the actual construction to the keep?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is one of Uriel's staff. In which case, we cannot talk to them right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the individual responsible for the construction of the keep was Lord Riskel Daxio, which is an elven gentleman on the Council that helped oversee the whole construction and helped you guys design it, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is he still on the bed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still on the bed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are, to a certain degree, as well. We're not leaving your side, and really there's no other choice. I mean, you're fucked like we are. So we will do our best to protect you, I promise you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I volunteer to sleep down in the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He shall stay in my quarters.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's better down here, isn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In a locked cell with Grog? I think is pretty safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's probably better to bring him upstairs, because if it's locked, we can't get to him very quickly.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Don't worry, we can enchant his room, as well, to have an alert thing go on if anything happens in the room at night, and it would be safer. I shall be sleeping in my laboratory for the next several nights, as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I can still go ahead and do the planar bindings to an elemental that maybe I should've done beforehand. It lasts 30 days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like all of these things, but I think Grog as a bunkmate is a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Desmond leans into you and quietly says in your ear, Vax, he goes, "Is where "I'm sleeping going to be away from him?" He looks over towards Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, totally away from him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine. You'll have him in between you and him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't hear that; it's whispered to Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But the answer is yes. You will be separate from Percival. You will be protected. And you have my word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you have my axe!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20, with Luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes another bite of the sandwich and packs it away in a little piece of cloth he had in a pocket, puts it in there. And you know, you can still see as he brings his hand up, you can see the blood streak against where the fingers were on the lower half of that hand. Strokes the edge of his chin and goes, "Okay. I trust you. Please. Please don't let them kill me."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We may be fuck-ups--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Speak for yourself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we're not without ability. You have my word. I promise you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. I'm very tired."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Desmond, dear. Let's go upstairs. Grog! That bed needs to go back up to the guest room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking hell. I start to take the fucking bed up the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes you roughly another 20 minutes or so to bring it out of there, fitting it through the door.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Erwen! Where is that old man?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you call out, Erwen eventually comes down. "Hi. Yes, Tiberius. You called? It's quite "early in the morning." He has his night cap on and he's rubbing at his eyes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, it's about probably 6:30 in the morning or so. It's just after sunrise; you guys haven't even slept yet.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Shit. Never mind, I'll talk to you once we've slept. Go back to sleep. I didn't realize what time it was! I thought it was 10:00 AM, which is totally different than 6:00 AM. I didn't know that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right. All right. In the morning then, Master Tiberius." And he goes off to his bed to sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We go to sleep?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we need to sleep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gently fall asleep under Percy's workbench, where I've been hiding this whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a stealth check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not going to sleep down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. As the rest of you go to sleep--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go into my workshop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ask, is your hand all right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you need anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Since he's sleeping in the room with me, I take a few of the caltrops that I have and I put them on the inside of the doorway before I close it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys are doing your setup there. Percy, you're in your workshop. Go ahead and roll a perception check, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Okay. You go about your work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fixing my gun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The materials that it requires you to do so are expensive, you actually have to pay the cost of the gun, and go ahead and make another check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The fuck is that sound?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and make another tinkering check. And the cost of the Pepperbox should be at the bottom of your--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it the whole cost or half?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should be half the cost. It should say under the repair rules for a misfire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, tinkering check. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically, that would be a success.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So you take the rest of the morning, unsleeping, the dark bags under your eyes. You manage to get the Pepperbox back in working order.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I was asleep. I wasn't with them, so I just woke up really early.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, right. But even so, even though you slept, it hasn't been very restful. It's been technically enough to rest, but your evening has been fraught with nightmares. Perpetually. But your Pepperbox is repaired, and does cost you half the cost of the weapon cost to repair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 75 gold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I sleep in my little nook in my laboratory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys rest through the rest of the morning, waking up past noon, probably about 2:00 in the afternoon. You all gradually begin to come to consciousness. Make your way downstairs. As you come downstairs, you can already smell breakfast has been prepared. You can see Laina already has the meal set out for you, and as you guys approach, "Oh it's so nice of all of you to come "down! It was very interesting. These very nice folks came by this morning and dropped off a whole "bunch of food and fresh veggies and stuff. Makes for a great meal. It was very nice of them. Food "is served." And she gives out the plates and gives you a smile.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love you. (eating noises)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this a frittata?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I believe that's what it's called in some circles. I'm trying a few new things!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I make a beard check?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to take some food and feed it to Lockheed and roll for my animal handling for the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No effect, unfortunately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a little tingle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having your meals and you're trying and you're feeding food, teaching this, everyone roll a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At home?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This frittata is lovely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16. But my passive is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, understood. Good to know. Percy's down in his workshop. As you guys are in the middle of your meal, you hear, clearing the stillness and quiet of the low munching-up, (clears throat) and sitting at the table adjacent to you guys, completely unnoticed in his entry, is Seeker Asum, arms crossed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfucker, you are sneaky! I need to talk to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are not cool right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, obviously not. That's why I'm here to have a conversation with the rest of you. Please "continue to eat. I don't mean to disturb you."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, very well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Help yourself to a frittata.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've already eaten, but I appreciate the offer."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Try this hakuna frittata. It's really good!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hakuna matata?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let him talk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What a wonderful meal. Well, things have certainly gotten sticky, haven't they? Well, first "and foremost, I would like to thank you, Keyleth, for clearing my head. Lord Briarwood had locked me "into some form of mental charm during my attempt to aid Vax--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I told you it worked! Sorry, I'm a little defensive right now. Continue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all right. Things are a bit mixed up. It's hard to explain; let's just say I have "been clouded in my judgment for the past few days until you cleansed me. I'm sorry to uphold the "charade back in the palace."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Apologies are mine, I think. I believe you had some sort of plan, and I thought I knew better, and for that I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I cannot say that is untrue. But I accept your apology."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I roll for insight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll high!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! That was a shit roll. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a hard person to gauge, anyway. You gathered over time that most of his work deals in a network of spies and the gathering of information across all of Tal'Dorei, so he is very well-trained to hide the essence of his true nature and the intent. Hard to read. But he seems pleasant as he's been, and given the circumstances. "Nevertheless, I accept your "apology, and I apologize for having upheld the charade during the council meeting, but I had to "keep up appearances so as not to cause any sort of stir at the time. I fear, based on my observations "since, that our very own sovereign also fell to the same charm I did and has been clouded since "the dinner the night before."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! That makes sense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were afraid of that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's fallen for that stuff before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's been through quite a bit, and while he's a resolute and a very good man, I would say "that he is predisposed to outer influence from those that are quite strong-willed."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And this is why you kept up our accusations against us in front of him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Under those conditions, the room filled with guards that were all intent against keeping "you at bay. Should you have made any attempt to try and cleanse him as well during that time, I "think you all would have wound up in prison. Or worse."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So why didn't you want to show that you were also cleansed? What was the point of holding up the charade?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because when you're under this influence, to speak against the proposed ally of the charm is "to draw a line. I wish to stay in his good graces because that would enable us a much better chance "of getting you close enough to him to absolve him of this charm. If I was to reveal this "instantaneously in the presence of the entire council, I fear that might have put me in the same "court of disfavor as you and lost any future chance of expelling this influence."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you it's only Uriel, or do you think it's the rest of the council as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Best I can gather, most of the council is not as well-- how do I put it? Not used to "business with Vox Machina. Allura seems to be of clear mind, as she is very powerfully protected "against such influences and did not have any immediate interaction with the Briarwoods during "that dinner. I fear the intent was on the sovereign himself."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, are you saying that the Briarwoods corrupted him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Same way they corrupted me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: During the dinner? While we were all sitting there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Apparently, it takes naught but a glance."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit! They could have gotten any of us.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. They did. Me. It was rather inconvenient. I hate them. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think we have something in common."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't you deaf?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that was brief.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I mean, what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that why you're talking so loud?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. I was getting it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could continue to work to clear your name, "during his distraction southward, if you have some idea as to how we could get close enough to him to "absolve him of this now, that would leave the risk of, should anything go poorly, being poked with "many spear holes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it possible to sneak into his room, and restore him without anybody knowing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you're confident. That may be more of a mission for the quieter of your bunch, should they "be a little more intelligent with their actions, going forward."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What about drawing him out to a luncheon or whatnot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will say, based on recent circumstances, he is very careful and defensive."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have fair chances of getting in, but no ability to cure him of any such thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) Unless they're caught, in which case, you've got two of our members against the entire palace guard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So then you go with them and Dimension Door out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't even want to face the little invisible thing downstairs!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Why don't we hold a special dinner?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He hates our fucking guts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we let Seeker Asum finish?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seeker Asum, in your opinion, is it safer to try and heal him or to try and clear our name through the traditional legal means?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Honestly, I have no idea. I think this plan, if successful, is quite inspired. However, "failure would probably end in the immediate incarceration and/or death of both individuals "involved. Public execution does not befit the country-wide name of Vox Machina, if you were to "fail. If you were to succeed, that would be the most direct route between two points."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So are we in agreement that we have to clear Uriel's mind first?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. No, the other option is to clear our names and not worry about clearing his mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uriel, if he's got his mind controlled, it doesn't matter if we try to clear our names, he's going to find us guilty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But during our trial, we will have a direct line of sight to him, we might be able to get through to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does he still trust Allura?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, if we kill the Briarwoods, is this even a point?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's definitely suspicion there, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He did. He did question her allegiances.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever you choose to do, if it requires my aid, "I will give it a day before I have to leave. My next intent is to head-- well, I wish to go past "the eastern curtain set up by Whitestone into Wildemount. I have spent the better part of the "past day since the cleansing seeking all records of the Briarwoods and their doings. There was a "period of about eight years in which there is no public record of their goings-on. It appears that "most records that deal with their involvement in Wildemount, and whatever homestead gave them their "title, Lord and Lady Briarwood, has all been but erased. So I intend to go to the source, "Wildemount itself, and research. This will take me some time, of course."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: When do you plan on leaving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sooner the better. I was thinking tomorrow."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Percy here? Is Percy in the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy is not even here. Percy is down in the workshop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go get Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to be at the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. I come around the corner, and I see Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you come around the corner, Percy is currently leaning up against the side of the wall, listening in to the conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey! I was looking for you. You want to come and actually join the conversation for once, instead of sitting outside the door and just listening to them? Because I really feel like this is going to be your time to input and maybe really help?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't feel like doing that. Oh. Lead on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would he be safer in our hands, or within the castle walls?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy and I walk in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm fucking asking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that depends. If you have strong defenses, and the enemy has no means of entering, "then he will be safer here. The palace itself is a very well-protected area; however, there currently "is an open invitation into the palace, and if the essence of our enemy is as I think it is, then "they can enter whenever they like."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we're really choosing between two paths here. Either we stay in town and tinker and gamble, or we're runaways.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Runaways? No, we go to the Briarwoods--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I'm talking about. The minute we leave, we're outlaws. They've told us not to go.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We can leave, we just cannot flee. We can travel as we see fit. We just need to let them know where we're going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but we can't tell them 'we're going to check out your associates'.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we lie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what's the name of the town?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whitestone?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not Whitestone. Oh, I thought he was saying he was going to go to their hometown.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to Wildemount, the kingdom that they're originally from. The continent to the far east.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's not going to Whitestone. He's going to go to Wildemount, which is on another continent. If we go to another continent, it doesn't matter if we're fleeing or not. It's going to look like fleeing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you going to Wildemount, again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm trying to find as much information to incriminate them in case whatever you're "attempting does not work."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Seeker, would you mind staying for a week or so before your venture? We need time to convince the council to let us leave without conflict and to procure particular items and things that we need. Very briefly. Would just take some time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have already made arrangements for travel. I could try, but depends on what you need "me here for."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do we need him here for?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ultimately, protection or a good ear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you genuinely think they're going to let us go with permission? We're not on their good side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, they're not. They're not going to let us go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going to be outlaws. We have to clear ourselves by ending the charm on Uriel by finishing off Sylas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or by killing the Briarwoods, thus ending the charm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sylas Briarwood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So that would be a way to clear your name and clear his head."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percival--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What of eight days instead of two weeks? Oh, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percival, what do you think we should do? Go seek revenge on your family and get some blood on our hands, Briarwood blood? Or do the sneaky thing and try to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please, we need your input.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know them better than anyone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really don't. I think we're here because I wasn't prepared.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check on him? See if he knows more than what he's saying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go ahead and roll a d20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that a nine?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there anything you're holding back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems clear as day, telling the honest truth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think we're here in this city to become lords and ladies serving Uriel, as good a man he is. I think Percival's our ally, and this is a grievous wrong done to him, and we can kill two birds with one stone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we are in the situation we're in because we now know how much we don't know. How much I don't know. I'm not prepared. If we face them now, I'm going to get you all killed.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There's other things that we should research, as well, and probably arm ourselves for that kind of conflict, if it comes to it. Quite frankly, I have a feeling if it's the whole town we're dealing with, we need to find out how many innocents there are to save, and if the number is low enough, we can fly in with an army ourselves, which would take some time. The Draconian Knights. I am an ambassador to Draconia, officially, after all the assistance I've sent, in giving them the Wheel of Mending, and proving my point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You gave them the Wheel?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I showed it to them, proving that my quest was true, which they gave me full ambassadorship, which means that, if harm comes to a Stormwind, harm comes to all of Draconia. And a town full of vampires and liches--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't know we had a whole army at our disposal. That's wonderful to hear.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: If worse comes to worst.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Started on the bottom, now we're here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Diplomatic immunity.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Draconia will not go into things alone. We need a union.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree. While we're not serving Uriel, that's not our purpose, I also don't want to leave an enemy of the state. That's not good for me, for what I want.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I go up to Jarett. Eight days. What do you think of eight days?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what, go with Jarett? Not Jarett, Asum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We would be going to Whitestone, right? That's where the Briarwoods are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But Keyleth, Uriel is the law, and the law is now corrupt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then why don't we save his mind before we go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's the thing. He's going to find out stuff about the Briarwoods. What's the fucking point of him going if we're just going to go attack the Briarwoods before we know what he knows? We need to let him go, find out his shit, take care of Uriel, wait until he gets back, go take out the Briarwoods--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As Vex is saying this, Tiberius is getting a half-chub.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's just weird.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You can't see it because it's inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, but you said it out loud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just saying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a strategy boner?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a strategy chub, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still weirded out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got to give context to those things, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an odd choice of words, but now 30 seconds later, I see what you mean

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry. Her brain. That's what I'm talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe a few days."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How soon will you return?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That depends on if I even return. Every spy I've sent to seek information on the Briarwoods or "to Whitestone has not come back."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (ripping noises) I'll give him two strips of Scroll of Telescription. If any harm falls upon you, write on this. I explain what it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. How many of those do you have left, by the way?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have 30 tickets left, so 28 now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have another idea. Uriel said that-- he was resistant, but he said that he would bring me in to have his people check me out. Check out my story. What if Keyleth and Scanlan rode in my pockets--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not that small.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As roaches.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're pretty small. Just as mice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or bugs. Roly-polies!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Magic user's choice. Can you cast magic when you're transformed?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So they'd have to pop out. Can you shrink yourself and still do magic teeny-tiny?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you asking me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Either of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but I can shit on things. Yes?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can you give the Seeker an inspiration before he goes on an adventure?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It could last him 20 minutes, yes. Get him to the docks, maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seeker, what do you think? What was your goal of coming here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, do you want us to come with you or what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My journey requires the utmost of silence, speed, stealth, and I mean no offense to your "entourage, but I think I can do this alone, and should. However, this journey may take me two "weeks, a month, many months-- I do not know. I'm doing this just in case whatever you're choosing "to do fails. At least, if Vox Machina falls in this, I can come back with proof enough to try, and "once the army has been gathered, perhaps we can rally all of Emon against Whitestone."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you die, can you write a letter and sign your name saying that we were right, you were wrong, you were full of shit, the Briarwoods are assholes--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But a lot more eloquently than that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can try my best."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up to his arm, and I Druidcraft a wooden armband. Make it look cool. And put that on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Onto Tiberius?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you're okay with that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could've shat on him and had the same effect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about being invisible? Can you cast spells while you're invisible?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Only with Greater Invisibility, you can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Going into a giant, vampire-lich-ridden castle and killing two evil bastards amid their army of protectors is the coolest thing we could ever do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's super-duper cool. Here's the thing: it's not going to be just two, I don't think. It's going to be an entire town of people that they've controlled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You think we can get into Sovereign Uriel without anyone detecting magic on us? He's got clerics all round him--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but Seeker Asum knows all the ins and outs of the palace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's leaving town tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'd have to do it stat, but he knows how to get in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did say it was an inspired idea. His words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I cannot dilly-dally. I'll take your band, yes." He takes the wooden band and puts it around his arm and says, "If this will put you at ease, I'll "take it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could you potentially help us with sneaking in the castle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could get you in the door, but I could not escort you to that room. That would put myself "in extreme danger and the entirety of our mission."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you distract people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "I can do that quite well, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can get there, but something tells me we're still going to be fighting a big fight in a palace. I'd rather fight that big fight in the Briarwoods'.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan and I are in agreement, and here's the problem. If things go south in Uriel's palace, we are then forced to fight against people who are good and true, or give up and go to jail, which sucks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But in the Briarwoods', we can kill every motherfucker in that place.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There are a number of innocents that we need to figure out, still.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we talk to Allura?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You killed an old lady!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She attacked us! And I will not back down from that decision.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She did have an old lady smell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Can we just vote on something, please? Since Percy's being oh-so-quiet about all this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy is being very quiet about this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure you have nothing to say?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's fucking your family. It's the people that attacked your family. Do you have no contribution to this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I still feel terrible about dragging you all into this and putting you in danger.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're choosing to do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vengeance." A voice whispers in your ear, Percy. No one hears this. "Vengeance."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you're with me, we can be prepared for them this time. We know enough to prepare ourselves, we can have ourselves ready this time.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How many days do we have? I would like eight days to prepare.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see if he looks like shaken or fucked up at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's obviously had a horrible few days.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think a week to prepare is reasonable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then leave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then we leave. We leave quietly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, we're leaving to Whitestone?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been avoiding it for too long, and now I know too much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, I agree with you. I think this is the right choice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All opposed, say nay. Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then it is settled. I'll be on my way."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait! Before you go, could I talk to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Certainly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Were you going to say anything else? Because I'll talk to you in private.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three days and I'll be off on my side of the mission. Very well."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll follow you out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and he walks out, walks with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold on, I'm going to hold you before you go. I just wanted to say, I'm so sorry and thank you. And thank you for doing this for me. I fear my temper before this weight is lifted from my heart. I do not wish to lose myself like that again, and I am so sorry for everything I've done.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Tiberius puts his hand on Percy's shoulder, and go, I'm sorry for the tragedy which is your family, and what these Briarwoods have befallen to them, and I will promise you, I will do my best to have you give that final blow from that barrel to the names assigned to them. But now it is a far dangerous situation, as you very well know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will do my best to maintain myself. I apologize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you all scatter, Percy, as you walk out, the same voice creeps into your ear, "Yes." Now, as you step out with Seeker Asum, who now has a bit of haste to his step, arms crossed, looking around. "So you wish to speak with me?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I do. You're a ranger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very sneaky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can be."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've only ever seen people like thieves, like my brother, do things like you've done. Can you teach me anything that you know to help me maybe be a little more stealthy, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "We'll go over what you know, and perhaps there are a few tricks that I can teach you "in the three days I have. I can't guarantee that it'll be extremely changing, as that's a very "short time to train over what I've learned over a lifetime, but I can certainly attempt."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I appreciate it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I require your concentration for those days, though, before I leave."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Utmost.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Meet me at the morrow, crack of dawn. I'll be at the front of your keep."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well." And he heads off, outside of the keep. The rest of you, what are you doing?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I go to my laboratory.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 3:00, 4:00 in the afternoon now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That temple of Sarenrae is in the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's part of the keep, yeah. Oh, you mean the actual temple you went to? That is inside the city, yes. You can go into the city; you just can't get to the Cloudtop District.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Use the earring real quick. I'm going to write a quick letter. If anybody goes shopping, let me know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tiberius loves shopping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He really, really does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, we'll go ahead and take a quick break. We'll be back in five minutes. Keep it a stringent break, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So errands will happen after that break? Because I have some errands that I want to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So to try and expedite this, over the next period of time you guys want to take to prepare, what are you going to do? Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to finish up those things that we talked about earlier, spend some time making some ammunition, and I'm going to attempt to build what we were talking about earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a tinkering check for your ammunition.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What we were talking about? Can I help him with that? Can I assist him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say the tinkering, the mechanisms involved, would be so far beyond your understanding as a druid. Even just metalwork in general. You can cheer him on, but would not be able to assist him with it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go Percy, go! That's pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? Okay. You manage to produce 25 rounds for your Pepperbox and ten rounds for the Bad News.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You still have inspiration from Scanlan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I used that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Used that to repair his Pepperbox. Roll for the secondary construction. Smoke bombs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you're attempting to make, you're attempting to make, based on what you told me, an Archimedes death ray.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not hard. I say that as, like, knowing my actual skill level, I could make one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could. To be functional with the materials that are at your disposal, it's going to be very large and hard to move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were talking about making it collapsible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could make a collapsible one, where it's basically a one-third dodecahedron, like an observatory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You spend the remainder of this week of preparation. Go ahead and roll your tinkering check. This is going to cost you in materials.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wait, hold on, can I pause real quick? You don't need to do this if you want to make more ammo and other stuff. I can do this without you making this and spending the rest of the time, if you want to make other stuff. Option.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Story-wise it's more amusing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. All right, so. The actual materials for this--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's copper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, it's copper, but the actual dodecahedron that's involved, the mirrors, the lenses, the whole thing? In order to be of the scale and quality to even make it even remotely functional, all of it for the extremely high quality and some of it custom-made within the first couple days within this, with a rush order. I'd say the total cost is going to come to about 1,200 gold pieces.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll pitch in for that. How much do you have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At this point I have less than 100 gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have less than 100 gold? I'll pay for it in full.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is the diameter of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The actual focal lens is about this big. The whole construct can be carried by two people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But it will fold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I was just going to say, what's the radius of the actual thing's lens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of the lens itself? This is the radius of the lens. I mean, even when it's collapsed, it can be carried by one person, but it's still a heavy mechanism.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So it's only one foot? Two feet? Three feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's about two and a half feet in diameter.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are you sure you want to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's already agreed. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why? It's fine. This is what we were talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Through the materials and the construct of it, you get partway through the final stages of it, and as you're tightening one of the sections, all of a sudden there's a (cracking) sound. Your whole body freezes as you glance over. the lens itself has a giant crack through it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There shouldn't be a glass piece-- aw, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the construct for this one, there was a focusing lens that is part of what the initial blast, otherwise there wouldn't be a point of actually projecting a ray from.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I thought they were all mirrors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's all different sorts of construction based on. This one's the one we're going on here, or if you can say the center of it is a gem, but regardless, the tinkering roll was not high enough to construct the device. Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The whole thing's wasted? Can we try and repair the crack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not something you can repair. The entire piece is constructed from a solid piece.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What, could we put it on the Mending Wheel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could attempt to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (grunting) Let's see. Okay. (clicking noise)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to go to the store. I would like to get a shovel and a pickaxe.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You going to Gilmore's? We're going to Gilmore's, too. We could go together if you're doing that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't give a fuck where we go. Just a shovel and a pickaxe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pickaxe... comes to four gold pieces for the two of those. You got them. Make a secondary tinkering check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. This time you go back and as you're tightening it, the actual metal housing of the device ends up bending in a way that both cracks the gem and causes the frame itself to be dented to the point where the beam will be imperfect. This is a very hard thing that you've come up with in your mind that has not been constructed before, and the level of difficulty to create this is very difficult. It does not cost you additional money, thanks to the Mending Wheel, but right now the entire device looks like to continue, it's going to take more time and money to construct it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) I can always use this for spare parts for other things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're already 1,200 in? How much more would you have to put in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say about half the cost. An additional 600.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And how many more days?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two more days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many more days do we have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You agreed upon eight, so we'd be pushing about seven, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've already built a smoke bomb and some rounds of bullets. All right, I'll put a little more time in this. Can I get some inspiration for this, too, if that would be possible?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Music, you mean?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's nothing I can do to help him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately-- what's your intellect?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My intellect? I've got plus three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Here comes the sun--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) It's all right. (vocalizing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Kill the vampire.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on, come on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy roll. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This design is beyond your grasp right now. You're inventing something that takes quite a lot of time to eventually perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to put these away for a later time, and if I have one more day, I would like to work on--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe a version of it that is not collapsible that we can at least mount?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got it taken care of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's been your guys' week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's my week, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You bought your pickaxe and your shovel. Cool. Vex, what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm training.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're training, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I want to be brief. I have four things I want to do, but I'll be very brief. I promise. Okay, so first thing I want to do is I think at some point, I heard Tiberius talking about wooden stakes and vampires. So I want to go buy about ten wooden stakes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I give him extra. Get me 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going shopping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, get me some holy arrows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I get a loaner on that? I've got about 230 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought you said you were going to be brief. (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On my own.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we got a bit of an allowance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a week, so I get some gold from these people and I go and I don't even know what they said. I'm getting ten wooden stakes for myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, technically, because Tiberius requested ten. Those will cost you a total of two gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I thought. And what did you want?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanted some holy arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holy oil.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll get to that. Investigation, you say? That is a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. Asking around the town: holy arrows, that is an enchantment. They're pricey and they don't appear to be anywhere in the major shops, even shops like Gilmore's, that they specialize in. It's usually a special order-type thing. Holy water flasks can be purchased at 20 gold apiece.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The next thing I want to do is go to the temple of Sarenrae and get my sister's holy oil for her. How much is that?
