lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holy oil? As opposed to the holy water?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take both, if you've got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holy water is a one-use. Holy oil can be applied to a weapon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Holy oil.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How much do the stakes weigh? Like each stake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A cluster of ten, if that's what you wanted, would weigh about five pounds. But they're relatively light.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Tell him that he bought me 20 more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell him that he bought you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 40 stakes, four gold. Totally happened. Then I went to the temple of Sarenrae and I got two vials of holy oil. One for my sister, one for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are 100 gold apiece.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll get four vials of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I gave him gold to do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll work that out, I promise. I ask if the cleric who helped bring Pike back to life is here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Tristan is here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jesus, how do you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because I have to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When I find him I say, you remember my friend Pike? You remember me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, I inspected you. Is that healing well, by the way?" He inspects the wounds on the side of your neck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: [no audio]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he steps away, goes back, disappears for a minute, comes back and he's holding in a chain around his neck-- It's seen some years of use, but still clean and very well kept, an identical holy symbol of Sarenrae as the one that Pike keeps around her neck. He hands it over and puts it over your head. "May she keep you safe and bring your soul to redemption."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It reminds me of my friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As it should." Pats you on the cheek. "As it should."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so chore number two down. I would like to go to Uriel's temple and ask the guards if anyone has seen my belt, Simon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are stopped at the edge of the Cloudtop District. The guards see you as you approach and block the doorway and say, "We're sorry, but Vox Machina has been given no passage into the "Cloudtop District at this time."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand. I don't mean to go in. I understand that we caused a lot of trouble, and I am very sorry, and I don't mean to be any further trouble. There is a belt that I left inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's certainly unfortunate, isn't it?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you seen a snake called Simon? Or any snake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both the guards look at each other and laugh for a second. "Piss off."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go back. I give everybody their things. I would like to spend the rest of the week, because I am ready, hanging out across the road from the butcher's house that Kynan ran from, and if there are any youths his age who go there to shop, I would like to ask as they leave if they have any idea where he's gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thought it was a one. (laughs) That is a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Okay. Keeping an eye out, you do eventually come across a boy that looks about his age. Late teens, maybe early twenties. Comes by and gathers a little bit of meat and rushes off and you stop him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, I'm sorry to take you away from your day. I'm sorry, what is your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Jameson."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jameson.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, can I help you? I've really got to get home with this."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand, I'll just take a second of your time. I owe a boy who lives here named Kynan, I owe him a few silver and I want to see that he gets it. Is he in town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll use the meteorite. That's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, gives you a look over and goes, "I'm certain you've given him silver, but Kynan's been gone "for the better part of a week."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where would he have gone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. He just told us all he was off to find his destiny or some sort of "bullshit like that. He's always had his head in the clouds, that one."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I agree. He ever talked about where he was going, how he meant to go about doing it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, kept to himself mostly. Sorry, I wish I could be more of a service. If I see him, where "should I send him?" (clattering)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know who that guy is. If you see him, tell him that V. is looking for him at Greyskull Keep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I'll pass that along."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good day," and he hurries off to continue with his errand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you all right, old man?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that your last errand?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I go to Gilmore's. Are we near Gilmore's?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Gilmore's in the city. He's not in the Cloudtop, so you have access to him still.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to know if such a thing exists, and if so, how much. A potion or a scroll that could invoke either Hallow or Spirit Guardians.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Say what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spirit Guardians is four. Hallow is five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here we go. Okay. Asking around, there are no potions for it, but there is a Scroll of Hallow available, and I will say that comes to roughly 6,000 gold pieces for the Scroll of Hallow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's how much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 6,000 for the Hallow Scroll. And for the Spirit Guardian, you said it was? 4th-level?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 4th-level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one is 2,000 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does that do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spirit Guardians would make some beings around us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spirit Guardians is level three, actually, not level four. That makes it a lot cheaper. That is 600 gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It scares evil things away. It's like a Pike-y thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I cast that if I have a scroll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have a scroll you can, yeah. It has a chance of failing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you have to have magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much did you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 600 gold pieces.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll buy one of those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's only one available. So you mark that down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Yes, I will. I would also like to find a smithy of some sort and make me a little metal choker of chainmail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, remembering that you have spoken to Karin before, which is the renowned custom blacksmith in Emon, you speak with her. A chainmail half coif around the neck there is relatively inexpensive. It's a partial piece of armor. She looks at some scrap chainmail on the side and is like: "I'd be more than happy to use that for it. It shouldn't me take more than an hour, "two maybe at most."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get one for everyone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think they can bite besides the neck, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, technically, but still!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) Sure, I'll get eight of them, or seven of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven of those. I'd say for the whole seven it'd put you at 100 gold, because it's custom orders. Seven of those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Chainmail chokers

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Chainmail dickies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh wait, do you have one more?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A tiny one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She awkwardly judges and turns that request down. She's uncomfortable with that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then I bow and leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you got that. Yes. Just a second there, Tiberius.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go to Gilmore's Glorious Goods and ask at the front door if Gilmore is there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gilmore, unfortunately, is in Westruun currently. Still overseeing the construction of his expansion there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Understood. Who's the most knowledgeable person next to Gilmore in this store right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be... I can't find my updated NPC sheet. Do you remember what her name was?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sherri.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sherri. Sherri is there greeting you. "That would "probably be me."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What can you tell me about this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it. "If you're requesting identification of a magical item, that is a "service we charge."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sis, can I borrow some money?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much do you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much would that require?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "125 gold pieces per enchantment identified."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Talk her down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it. She steps inside, sets it on the counter. She starts going through her books and starts looking at it and holding it for a second and doing a full inspection of it. "Based "on the enchantment on this device, it's very crude in construction and the enchantment is in an "arcane offshoot of language I'm not very familiar with, but it appears it is a guard from some sort "of a mental influence. If worn, it would give you a stronger resistance against things that would "attempt to peer into your mind."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we talking magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes." So essentially what it would do is it would give you advantage on wisdom saving throws against magic spells.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Against?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would give you advantage on wisdom saving throws against magical effects.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fucking brilliant. I hand her the gold and say, Scanlan sends his regards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She noticeably blushes and goes, "Well, send mine back if you wouldn't mind. I've got work to "do." And she rushes off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Now, Tiberius.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 errands.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I only have eight. Just kidding, no. The real quick one is going to the Temple of Sarenrae to pick up a canteen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once that's expelled, all the rest that it creates-- because it's pulling it out of the elemental plane of water; that's how it's continuously projecting it. The rest of it runs straight through, so it doesn't have a chance to even absorb the blessing.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Gotcha. Okay, cool. Second thing. I drop off my Swallow, or I'll call it the surge blade, and to have that enchanted on both ends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: One side fire, the other side water. So however many mages I have to hire for that to happen in ten days, I think we talked about it being eight days or something like that? Or was that only one side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) So what enchantment do you want? Do you want to just do an additional-- What do you want it to be?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I just want it to be a magical weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a magical weapon? Okay, just a general plus-one magical weapon. Okay. That would take about-- let me double-check the rarity here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would run you approximately 700 gold to create it as a plus-one magical item. Would take one mage a week to do it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. So I'll do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I stop at Gilmore's and I drop off my Ring of Protection. And pay whatever that is to add a plus-one to make it instead of a minor, an actual Ring of Protection.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, the thing is, an enchantment cannot be progressively enhanced. You would have to disenchant and then re-enchant the entire thing.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I thought Gilmore said they could do that there, before. That's why I was going to cough up the green for the Gil, as it were.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. They can enchant the item with it, but it would be the cost of basically re-enchanting the item.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How much would that be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would cost approximately 25,000 gold pieces.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh jeez.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it would take the better part of a year. A plus-two Ring of Protection is a very powerful item.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's worth it. It's a good investment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That you even acquired one earlier was great luck.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How about buffing the ring of source spelling--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Ring of Spell Storing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The thing that I had that I still want. That one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Ring of Spell Storing? That's its enchantment. There is no more powerful version of the Ring of Spell Storing. If you wanted to attempt to do that yourself on your own time, you could. That will cost you upward 60,000 gold pieces and about a year.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, not right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about we stick to the level we're at?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I didn't know all that stuff was going to be that way. That's why I asked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you learn if you don't ask?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good to ask these things.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughs) So okay. While the days are going, I want to roll for animal handling to teach Lockheed stuff, which is every morning, whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say throughout the week, 'cause you've taught Lockheed a lot of things back to back. You can't cram everything in there in the three to four days and like: "You learn everything!" Because you've already taught Lockheed one thing this week. Roll for a second thing you want to teach Lockheed.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Like, with advantage? I'm just having fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I'll give you advantage on that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll advantage. Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For the sake of brevity, can I roll one beard check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can roll several beard checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 43. It starts filling in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aw, come on Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So by the time the week comes to an end, the other side of your beard has finally filled in and you are back to a full beard, Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, that succeeds. It takes you a few days to get it though, but what do you want to teach Lockheed?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I want to teach him to be quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Lockheed has learned to be quiet. Good. Anything else?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. I got that, that. Throughout the days, I'm going to go all the shops and see how many glass mirrors-- I'm looking for mirrors, just all kinds of mirrors, every size.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are plenty of mirrors out there. There are general stores that sell them all over.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm looking for five-by-five to ten-by-ten size mirrors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Feet?!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah. No, inches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I misunderstood. Yeah. You could've had them custom made if they weren't out there, but they have mirrors of that size available.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I need about 1,500 of them. Can I get 1,500? How many can I get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There aren't that many mirrors in the city.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. All of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, if you hold two next to each other there looks like there's a million of them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You know what, that's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're five gold apiece, and of what is currently available for purchase, you may be able to acquire about 35 mirrors, and you'll clean out most of the places that will stop selling them to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's cutting-edge technology in this day and age.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How many, if I laid them out on a flat surface, how many-- (laughs) How many feet would that cover?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you just bought 35, so that's about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17 feet! 17 whole feet of mirrors!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you're doing a square, it's three feet by three feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, four by four. So there you go. Four by four.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll take all that. How much is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 35 times five. So we're looking at 175 gold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Done. And then, for timeline stuff, I'm going to do as much as I can to start enchanting my bolts, and I'm going to go work with Keyleth on stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth's been working with Percy this whole time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The whole time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's taken the entire week for him, you said you were assisting him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you said I couldn't assist him. I had no intelligence to assist him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I thought you said you were still going to help cheer him on. Okay, then no worries. Then yeah, you're available.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to try to make as many sleep bolts as I can. But the other thing with Keyleth is I would like to enchant a bolt that is a smoke screen, but it consists of holy water. So I use a pour of the day from the canteen and use that as a mist instead of a smoke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The enchantment of an arrow to do that is the use of a Fog spell. There is no way to infuse a Fog spell with holy water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was saying. I don't know if you can do holy water. I can do a Fog spell.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can we infuse a Fog spell with a Sleep spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can we try super hard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Make a roll.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: God damn it. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like, the best I could possibly do is maybe take one of these holy water things.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What am I rolling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus arcana.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think it matters? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Okay. After spending approximately 500 gold in materials, the enchantment fails, both spells fizzled. You lost 500 gold. But now you know. Probably can't combine two spells into a single enchantment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And knowing is half the battle.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Don't worry, it came out of my pocket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got fog.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about you get nothing else, and we move on?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Last thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No last thing.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I stop at Allura's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go towards the Cloudtop District, and the guards stop you again.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I remember that as I walk up, and I go back to Greyskull Keep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, I don't do that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh wait, I don't do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: #OrionAcaba.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I realize what I'm doing, and I stop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also. This will just take ten seconds, at some point in the week, when Keyleth is taking a walk, I go into her garden, and I clip one flower, and I take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many sleep bolts?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go sleep in your money.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You said I could do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're busy this week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can he get back to the keep and we've all left four days ago? (laughter)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Carrying groceries in, look, guys: hoagie stuff!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dear Tiberius. We left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We got really bored and we left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I will say for each arrow, it will cost you 600 gold and will take you six days to do, per arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Six days per arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. It's one day per 100 gold of an enchantment. Which is even me making it higher than the book says. It should take you four times that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cool. Can it cost more if I hire a mage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screams)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to hire a mage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need to do shit, too. I can't be everyone's bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So three and a half days and it cost you 1,200 gold for a single sleep bolt.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sweet. And I do two of those. And I'm broke.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's spent people, he's spent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got to Gilmore's and I buy an alchemy set.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That comes to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 95,000 gold

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's going to be a lot more than you think, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alchemist supplies? 50 gold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not enchanted, yo. "It's magic, give me all the magic!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is made of things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is made of things. And then I go home and I make a few Cure Wounds potions. Try it out, since I've learned and I've been studying and I've been doing my research. So maybe a few level two, level three Cure Wounds potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A level two healing potion, a greater healing potion. The materials involved in creating that will come to, I'd say about 400 apiece, and you'd have time to create two. It's about four days per potion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispered) How much do they cost?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's getting a discount because she's making it herself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, they cost 500 to 600 and they cost 400 for me to make them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. It's your first time doing it. They'll probably get cheaper over time as you get better at it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, okay. Cheaper over time as I get better at it? That's funsies. Well, let me make-- What is that? A greater healing potion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a greater healing. So for each one you make, roll a d20 and add five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me make one for right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's an 18. That's pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then yeah, you successfully create the potion. No issue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome. I had a Percy-roll! And he hates me for it. How long will it take me to make a Daylight scroll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A Daylight scroll? What level spell is that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Third.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Third? That'll cost you about, I'd say, 600 gold pieces. It'll take you six days. You don't have time. You could pay more to have somebody else help you make one if you wanted to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, no, I want to experiment. I want to take one of those holy water bottles. And I want to see if I can enchant it with my Fog spell. To make it a holy water fog grenade. When you throw it, it'll go (shatters) with my fog spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know that upon throwing the holy water, it would shatter. It would create a fog, but the holy water itself would just affect the creature you threw it at. You'd be able to blend the two enchantments; they don't necessarily mix. The fog itself is not created from the water, it's created from the glass that you're enchanting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus, we didn't get any holy water, we only got holy oil to put on our weapons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a couple of flasks of holy water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if I enchant it with Daylight? Oh wait, it still won't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a whole different thing. Daylight, that's more of a scroll thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do it, anyway. I'm going to do the fog thing, because I said it. I'm going to commit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That will cost you-- I'll put it at 500 gold pieces. And that'll take you five days.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: For a fog scroll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, for the fog holy water thing. It's a holy smoke grenade.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Someday, we will get out of the character creation menu, but not this day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't like the nose yet. It's too low.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. That'll be my two things I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, roll another d20. Plus five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You feel the fog enchantment take shape in the glass vial. It seems relatively unstable. You gather that this glass was not meant to contain an enchantment from the get-go. You somehow manage to make it function, but you have to be very careful with that vial.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Here, put it in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who knows what'll happen if it actually is thrown?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't put it in a Bag of Holding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give it to Scanlan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who would like a very unstable item?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy's used to unstable things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give it to Scanlan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that a jab at my-- No, never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a fog-enchanted vial of holy water. You can write it down that way if you'd like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just put it on my back. I'll just hang it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, this is very delicate. Please be very gentle with this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will put it where I put all gentle things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You do not make the wisest decisions here your Majesty, I must say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I give everyone the chainmail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You give all the chainmail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Look at this, so fancy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take that fancy box I bought a couple times ago, and I take the blue crystal that we found in our very first adventure and I put it in and I seal it tight. Shit. I had one more thing I wanted to do. Oh yes, I drink my Shit-Scrying Potion, shit in a jar and leave it in the kitchen. And tell the help, don't touch it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) It takes much convincing, but nevertheless they acquiesce to your request, being the boss. All right. Anything else?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Just going to let the guards know to watch our guest while we're away. Keep him under protection.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we leaving him here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The what?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The guy who built stuff, regardless, did I do that or is that just in my head?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lord Daxio, you mean? What about him?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So I didn't do that yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you going to do something on his room, Keyleth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Watch him, watch for invisible anything. Protect him with everything you can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will do this with my life. Do not worry."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we given them a raise?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just gave him 200 fucking gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Double the guard on him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And yeah, everybody-- fuck. I give a hundred--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five of them make 100 a month, two of them make 50 a month.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give another 200 to him and tell him to pass it out to the rest of the guard. We'll be back soon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very generous, and I think they'll be very happy to find this. Thank you very much."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And add another guard to the watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two to Desmond. At all times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I will do this. Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I going to tell Erwen to go and ask for court for the lord that can construct and tell him that we would like to make some changes and have the cells converted into barracks for our soldiers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That won't do anything.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's what I do. That's what Tiberius does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Erwen goes, "All right, sir." And he wanders off.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Getting a good reputation does not mean holding prison cells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About an hour later Erwen returns and says, "I'm sorry. They would not allow me into the central "district. I do not have the proper papers to pass within. I mentioned that I worked for you, and "they told me I was not to enter."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, maybe you should have said a different name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They would have known when they got to our keep.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's true. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shall we head out?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I learn anything from Seeker Asum?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a d20, adding your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah jeez, really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if I roll like shit?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then it'll be hilarious. Roll that die. Come on. Roll high and it will be amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make it with advantage, because Asum is a very good teacher.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is. He's so good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (fake crying) No, that was terrible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Advantage!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are playing DND right now! All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus my wisdom. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is she an emperor now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Is that how this works? All right, so talking with Asum. He works with you for a bit and teaches you the ranger ability Skirmisher's Stealth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Skirmisher's Stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you start one of your turns hidden from a creature, you can then, as a bonus action at the end of your turn, make another stealth check to remain hidden from them. You essentially can dive between areas and still be hidden.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While I'm attacking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all ranger stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: (air horn noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. We'll go over the details of it after the game. Essentially, you learn a new ranger ability from Seeker Asum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. I bought some sticks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: At the end of the first day, before all of that stuff happens. Sorry, guys, this is necessary.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody shut up and let Grog go on a one man, solo kill spree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's bound to happen. He's going to secede.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tiberius, what do you want to do?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm in my lab the first night and I write a Scroll of Telescription to my father. And I go, dear father, and I tell him about the circumstances with the vampires.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dear diary. Sorry.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: At the end of it I go: I invoke the ambassador's right of war time as of now, and moreover as your son when I provide concrete evidence, you will know. But in the meantime, I would have you gather 50 ground troops of the Draconian knights and 50 winged soldiers of the wyvern fleet. Have them at the ready for my signal. I know it will take you a few days of travel to get here, but this is a town of vampires and possibly liches, which you know need to be destroyed no matter what. Your son, with love, Tiberius.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everyone is aware that Tiberius is the giant eagles in Lord of the Rings. Tiberius can invoke ultimate destruction at the call of whatever he wants.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't know what's going on over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tiberius, I trust that in time you will prove yourself to this family and to this country, "but for the time being, business matters of this larger scale are best left to those with "experience. With love, Kruvanis Stormwind."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) Send him three more letters.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Damn it. Have to provide proof to my fucking father. Fine. He didn't say no, which is what he always says. Which is a lot better than what he always says.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I walk into Tiberius' room while he's having this conversation with himself. And I say, what are you doing in here?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm talking to myself, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay. All right. I'm going to go get some garlic from the kitchen, and then let's go!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I write a note. Address it to Uriel, hand it to our main butler. Who I know his name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Erwen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we didn't flee. We'll be back, how about that? We'll be back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The note is left with Erwen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I tell him, only give this to anybody if they come looking for us and they're angry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, of course. Of course."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog? Do you think I should do the whole elemental guardian thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How are you doing, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been sitting here for 30 fucking minutes. I'm bored! Cast an elemental and make it smash everything around the keep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Water elemental seems appropriate based on our knowledge, yeah? Water elemental. And Planar Binding. And I talk to him in my elemental speech, which I can do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you say? (gargles water during Marisha's speech)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't have a drink.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That make you thirsty?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, you can speak English, you don't have to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The elemental gives you an acknowledgment and speaks back in its own tongue the equivalent of, for my time here, I serve.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what? I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For my time here, I serve" is essentially the essence of what you get from him

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For my time here, I serve?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For my time here, I serve. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Onward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know where we're going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I know where we're going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival de Rolo knows where we're going to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We head to Turst Fields.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we riding there by horseback? Is that what we're doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know where we're going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about four and a half days' travel horseback.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we purchased a carriage?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What if we went on airship instead? We have one at our disposal, do we not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we had one at our disposal when we were friends of the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's in the Cloudtop District, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we need to go on the down-low.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's not tell anybody that we're leaving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Carriage. Let's go. How much do they cost?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need a carriage? We have a stable full of horses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rein it in. We're going to fight vampires.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have four horses, and you technically have the teleportation sigil for Westruun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is Briarwood keep over there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Westruun's most of the way across the continent. It's about a day's ride out from Westruun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So that would shave time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would shave about three days off your journey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt, I'm pretty sure it's "si-google."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Turst Fields is just northeast of Westruun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's in those fields?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not really an extension of Westruun, but it's one of the closest cities. And they do a lot of food trade up into Whitestone, or did previously.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's where we would make our camp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's head there and make camp. And maybe talk about a plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I think, Percival, you're leading the way. Use my sister as an advisor, but you're leading the way right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to draw out a crude map while we make our way so I can let you all know where we're going.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, then join me in my laboratory, everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, yes. We go to Tiberius's laboratory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Tiberius, you go ahead and cast Teleportation Circle.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Not yet. I go, hey, look at the laboratory, guys. What do you think? Scanlan, it looks like you're impressed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (dryly) Oh, I'm very impressed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you cast Circle of Teleportation.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I use my sigil there. I got it set up there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, and the circle appears. You guys rush through it. You do not have your horses with you because they would not be able to travel through the teleportation circle with you. However, you could probably procure some while you're in Westruun. In doing that, you guys, for the case of brevity on this-- we've been missing that for a lot of this session.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do this in real time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say the total gold to purchase horses for the whole party--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After I haggled. Because let's be honest, I would've.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would've. Go ahead and make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You would've.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Even in real time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? Okay, yeah, would put you at about, we'll say because you are renowned in this area and you've helped Westruun. Helped them during the Winter's Crest Festival the year before, using that discount. You manage to procure everyone's horses, including your warhorse, for 210 gold, which is a pretty decent discount.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes it is. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I share my map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) You made a map?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You drew that just now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know I've forged all of our documents? You are aware of that, right? Any time we've needed papers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, where is Westruun? Oh, there's Westruun, that's where we are right now. So we have to go-- I just spit on your map, Percy. Up through the woods, into the mountains. Whitestone is mountains.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can handle that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I can handle both.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're here, and we've got to go here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's set out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The forest to the front of the city. There's also the Alabaster Sierras themselves, which surround that peninsula that extends into the northern part of the continent. They are very tall, fjord-like, craggy mountain ranges up against the sea along the edge. They're a little more treacherous, but a little more out of the way; a backdoor route. So you guys choose which route you want to take.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would prefer not the direct route.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Always go in the backdoor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you say that anything that is not laced with sexual innuendo?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mountain ranges are part of my favored terrain. We don't get disadvantage traveling through.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would prefer taking that direction. I don't want to head straight towards them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There probably will be mountain giants, though, remember, that throw boulders and they will be terrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Parchwood Forests are dangerous as they are. There's really no safe way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I trust Percy; whatever you say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you are aware that here have been problems in the past with various mountain-faring giants that lived north of Whitestone that occasionally would wander too far south. They mostly kept to themselves, but occasionally they had some crossover, there were some scuffles here and there. So you guys are deciding to take the Alabaster Sierras?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. I want to cast Pass Without a Trace on everyone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you come to a point where there is a falloff on the path, where the erosion or some sort of large impact of the side caused the path to fall into a scooped crevasse that is a smooth fall down the side. There is no way across other than a large sea salt air-rotted rope bridge that goes across about a hundred feet. You see it rocking (creaking) with the wind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think this looks very stable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man, you know what I would give for a flying fucking carpet right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So the bridge is out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the bridge can be crossed. It looks a little rickety. It's not terrible or frightening, but it's been there for a while, and you can tell from the color of the rope--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is it across?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A hundred feet.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Should I go first, everyone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to inspect it from an engineering perspective, if that's possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking at it, I mean, the anchors are pretty solid in the stonework. There's no looseness to their element. The rope itself is taut and seems to have serviced long enough. There are no signs of extreme wear other than just time and weather.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to walk forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to tie the fucking rope around your waist before you do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's quite a good idea!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sarenrae, jeepers. I'm going to use perception, I'm going to look at it before going out. That is a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Are you taking your horse with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I leave my horse with my sister. I'm on foot; I'm on all fours, really. Spidering out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Making your way across, you get halfway across the bridge. There's a creaking sound and slight movement as the wind picks up at times and you (creaking).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I'm lasting. What would I make, is it an insight check to decide if I thought Grog could make it across this thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check. Roll and add your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take that zero off it, and you've got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, Grog looks like a big guy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is fun. You swing back and forth. Grog, I think you might like this!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far across is the bridge? A hundred feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once you're across, let's secure the rope that's attached to you, and we'll make ourselves a guideline that we can hang onto.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, he sounds like a Debbie Downer, Grog, but I'll go across, and you can follow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No issue. The rope bridge carries your weight all the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tie a rope. I tie the other side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything on the other side I could tie it to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a couple of small cliffside trees that grow off in strange twisting bonsai tree-like branches that stick off. They're pretty sturdy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I use a sailor knot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use a special ranger knot that's really extra strong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's up next?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I double-knot mine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to get the horses across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, they ain't coming.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not coming? Oh. Well, I just Dimension Door across, then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jeepers! Will you warn a half-elf when you're going to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spooks you for a second. You hold on and you make your way across. You guys are now on the other side. You're holding onto everyone's horses left behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I tie up all the horses to a very large tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going by foot now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Looks like it. Tiberius, are you still on our side? Are you with me, still? Will you cast Fly on Trinket? I love you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sure. To make it across?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can climb on him and you cast Fly and you only have to use one little spell.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: If I cast it on him, I would probably jump on myself, because I'm a little bit heavier than you are, darling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then do it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's haggling you right now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You can have him afterwards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you can go, and I'll just use the little rope.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Fine. Proceed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cast Fly on Trinket--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I don't. I don't do shit yet. I wait for you guys to get across, so if something happens, then I can cast it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, just protect him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get on Trinket's back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he hasn't cast it on him yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who's going across now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you make it across. No problem. You're light enough and able to guide the movement of the bridge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good thing I only had one frittata the other day!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's my question. What looks shaky, the connection of the bridge or the actual, physical condition of the bridge itself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The physical condition of the bridge. There is no actual visible point that is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For bonus added safety in case this bridge gives way, I'm going to cast Grasping Vine and have it loop and wrap around the edge of the bridge. Further enforce it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vines reach around and wrap around the edges of the wood slats and the rope handholds, and it seems to be pretty well-held on that side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clever!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At least that side will be fine. And then I'll go across.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool, you make it across without a problem.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who else needs to go across?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just you and Tiberius and Trinket.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want me to go first?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And then as we start flying across, I cast Telekinesis on Grog and take him with me. Kind of like Green Lantern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Concentration spells.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah. That should be 12 seconds to get across a bridge, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking down, you can see a 600, 700 foot drop before the rock comes to a point which would probably splinter or crush anyone who fell into it, and then is pushed out to the ocean. So it's a little scary, but you start flailing about as you're being pulled across by Tiberius. Eventually, Trinket comes, lands on the other side safely. You guide Grog over, down onto his feet. Safe and sound.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one. The horses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, what do you want to do with the horses?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We tied them up.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to dispel the Fly. But I'm going to hold the Telekinesis for the ten minutes I can on Grog. I'm not going to do anything, I'm just going to keep that spell going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cool. All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I say a prayer of thanks to the horses, who will surely die of starvation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They were tied up in a super grassy area with a shit-ton of water around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They'll be eaten by something long before that. It's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So what's our plan? What are we doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The plan is walk until we get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The path pinches a little bit tighter as you go across, about a ten foot width and you guys begin pulling across. There's a sudden large gust of sea air blows in as you guys go ahead and buckle down to hold on. I'd like you all to roll an athletics check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we in mountains yet? So I have advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me too, because mountains are my favorite--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true, yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is this, acrobatics?

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Athletics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: ORION. 18.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you guys are holding tight, both Scanlan and Vax are trying to grab something, holding onto rocks, but before they can get enough, they're both so small, it pushes them out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How much time has passed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's three seconds. Oh! Passed since the bridge? About five, six minutes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I try to catch them because I still have the Telekinesis going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can catch one of them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (yelling) Why, Matthew?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because the spell has to be directed!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they flying off a cliff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're both being dragged by the wind off the side of the cliff. You can see them grabbing the ground. Vax is being pulled off the side as Scanlan is actually lifted off his feet.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I know Vax can't. I grab Vax!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tell my sister I love her!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I jump and try and grab Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax. You want to hold me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm Vox.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wait, you're grabbing him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm Vex.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I said!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You grab Vax and hold him in place as you reach out and grab Vax by the arms and pull him back onto--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, who?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh,

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog grabbed me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. But he still said he'd grabbed me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Then you're being held aloft by Tiberius' Telekinesis concentrating. Scanlan has fallen out of view.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I Grasping Vine him before he goes out of view.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Off the side of the cliff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an attack roll with your Grasping Vine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I can manipulate a thousand pounds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is to aim the vine as he falls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Not a problem! The vine grabs Scanlan and pulls him back and holds him as the wind slowly dies down.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I guide Vax back to the cliff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the sun's getting closer and closer to setting, you're making your way around the crest. You've been traveling this mountain range for a good number of hours now. You're at a decent height, you're on foot, a good distance inside the Alabaster Sierra mountain range. Perception check, everyone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three, two, one.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I rolled a natural one, with negative two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Those of you with a higher perception than 20 on this roll. As you pull along, you hear this echoing sound, this (bird-like sounds) in the distance, the wind's carrying it as it's blowing past you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it sounds like anything nature-based? Something I could possibly have talked to in the past?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it something I would know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intelligence check. You go ahead and make a nature check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is birdish in nature, but it sounds too guttural and too articulate to be a bird. There is enough of-- you notice there's a language of the chittering that is bird-like, but there is actual voice. You recall that there are various creatures that make the cliffsides home. One of the ones that are more obnoxious that some of the earlier traders of Whitestone had problems with making this path for mining were clusters of harpies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, fucking harpies.

lines.name: TALIESIN, ORION
lines.text: Harpies.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: They're the opposite of the Harpers, which are good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's a harpy?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A harpy's a jerk, a stupid butthole who's super loud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over as you guys are having this conversation. Behind you, you can see in the distance from where you were, a couple of these dark shapes swooping down. You see a cluster of about four or five of these harpies diving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we find a place to maybe settle down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we stealth? I cast Pass Without a Trace on us!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry! I can make us all look like cows again!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shushes) Everyone be quiet! MATT How long is the concentration on Pass Without a Trace? How long can you hold that concentration?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Up to one hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It has faded since then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are we against the mountain? Are we still on the mountain edge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're still on the path, and you look back from where you came from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we have a mountain behind our backs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a sheer cliff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn around and I cast Move Earth, my 6th-level fucker. And I (boof) and I clear out a cave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you're concentrating on this, eventually, Keyleth begins to focus, and over the next minute or so, she begins to push a cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on us now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're distracted as they're slowly tearing apart what you gather are the horses you left behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Terrible!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Good news is, they're distracted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Horses saved our lives, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bad news is they're probably not going to be there when you come back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's getting dark. I think we should camp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you're saying there's a chance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over the next few minutes or so, Keyleth, you've pushed a good ten by 15-foot cavern into the side of this wall that didn't previously exist. You guys are able to step out of the light as the sun's starting to disappear over the mountain range, the Cliffkeep, which you can see in the distance across this channel now. There's a channel of water between the two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go ahead and Druidcraft a little campfire. Tiberius, you want to light a fire for us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use Hide in Plain Sight. I'm going to see if I can do this. That sort of ability to camouflage the opening of the cave to where they wouldn't be able to see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure! Go ahead and make a stealth check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! You take the next 15 minutes or so, finding what nearby pieces of brush you can and rocks that have been loosely around the area and you start setting up this pattern of them that closes off some of the entrance from the smooth opening that Keyleth had created. It takes a little ingenuity because it's just a rock opening, and there isn't a whole lot of brush and things around. But you feel you've managed to mask it to the point that to a distant eye it would be hard to see that there is an actual cavern there. At this point, the sun has set, night has come in, and you guys are sitting within this cavern hearing the distant sound of the ocean waves crashing against the bottom of these cliffside, coastal fjords.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me and Tiberius made a fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, a fire is made.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I lit it with my spitting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Tiberius forms a relatively useful and effective campfire within this cave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I want to use my holy oil and dip a couple arrows in the holy oil because I know I can make three based on what we've done before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yes. Do be aware, the holy oil will only last about a day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really? Oh, so I'll do that right before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one of those things where if you dip it now and leave it, over time it'll just either evaporate or drip off of the arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While my sister's looking at her shit, I bogart Trinket and climb up onto him, use him like a sleeping bag and cuddle into his softest warm parts and fall asleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear groaning) Trinket, at first, just haplessly pushes you away, but recognizes your scent and lets you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You ganked my sleeping bag.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, not sorry.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I find a little patch of dust and do a little dust bath real quick and then I'm going to use one of my books of stuffs and start researching liches just because I want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I mean, what book would you be researching this in?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Tobin's Spirit Guide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The researcher ability is that you can go to places of research and find books. You don't really keep a tome of all knowledge with you. The next time you find a town or you're in town, then you can use that ability to research in advance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I ask Grog how he's doing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm bored as shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to arm wrestle?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, do it, Grog! Come on, you can't beat a girl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you guys all rest for the evening?

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we should take watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still awake. I'm going to fall asleep last.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also stay up with Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wake me up when you're tired.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm gonna feed Lockheed some treats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys continue your business for the evening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I talk to Percy for a second. Percy, while we're alone for a moment, there's something that's been bothering me, and I can't get it out of my head. I thought I'd talk to you about it because I feel-- we're friends, right? We're friends? Are we friends?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure! I'd like to think so, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Been through a lot, been together a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a while, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two years now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I suppose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I go invisible to see if I can hear their conversation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perception or stealth? 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You are keeping relatively low and are able to overhear their conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, you're a very brilliant person.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't help but feel like I'm being watched right now. Never mind, forget I said anything. I can't help but feel like there's something else, there's something more to this that you're not telling us. And I didn't really think of anything until we were having that fight where Tiberius brutally murdered that old woman.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Been trying not to think about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, me too. But the one thing that I can't get out of my head was something that you said during that fight. And for a long time I was like, damn, Percy's got really cool one-liners and he's so smart, and I wish I could have cool one-liners. You and Grog have really cool one-liners. And then you said "your soul is now forfeit" to the person you shot that night. And I thought, wow! That was an interesting one-liner.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did say that, didn't I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah, you did. For some reason, I was the only one who noticed it, and I don't know if that's because I'm just reading into things, if that was just a really awesome, but scary and brutal thing to say in the moment, or if there's something deeper that you might be serving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, I'll say, I've had a number of years thinking about what I would do and what I would say and how I would go about this. This kind of obsession is not healthy, and I know that, and it's no way to live. And I'm sure that was something on the list of things I thought I would say, some attempt to be scary when I met them, as opposed to being scared, I think I was-- (sighs) again, I don't really remember much because I was so angry. I've never been so angry. And I think I was just trying to sound threatening. And I'd had these dreams before, you know I've-- you don't build anything like this without the knowledge that you're-- I'm aware that inventing this thing has been a mistake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pull out my gun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what are you saying? You had knowledge? You didn't build that without inspiration? What do you mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've had thoughts about it, but I didn't really think about what I was doing or what I was going to build until I decided to take my revenge, and I'd never thought about building it because I realized what a dangerous idea it was. (sighs) And I fear for the day that that comes back to haunt me. I don't know what I'll do, but I don't know, I think I was just trying to say something to be intimidating. I honestly didn't even think I was going to kill him, it just happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see if he's lying to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an insight check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Roll a d20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is your insight really that good?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm wise as fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And add your charisma modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Add my charisma modifier? 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, he's seeming honest, and sharing open-hearted to you. You feel like you've really gotten to the core truth of what Percy's about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? What did you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel like you've gotten to the core and truth of what Percy's about, and perhaps your questioning this has upset him, and you feel like maybe you've pushed this a little too far.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do regret what happened and I know he was a bad man, but I still hope to never lose my temper like that again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got to roleplay that shit. He convinced you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still really feel like we're being watched. Do you feel that? I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, I think we both need sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's really distracting. Yeah. Well, I love you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love you, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're in this with you until this end.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear the distant caws of seagulls waking you up as the heat from the morning sun begins to eventually hit this side of the cave. Since you're on this side of the mountain, by the time you wake up, you realize the hour's probably a little bit past noon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We overslept!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's so dark in here, because of the cave thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so wait. Percy, how much further out are we from Whitestone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather you probably have about a day's worth of travel, and you'll be able to make your way down into the ravine from here. You've come up quite a bit of the mountain range.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably another day before we can camp close enough to attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we stealth through the mountains, just in case they have any kind of lookouts?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, they will have lookouts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on us again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go slower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we all stealth? Try at least?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's keep stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you do notice that the path becomes broken and too steep to continue. It actually falls and tumbles down into this long, sliding ravine. There is a slight rockslide trail that you could climb up and over and it looks like there is a separate ravine, or a separation where the two mountains join, that could possibly be traversed. But continuing on the seaside path is not going to work. It does bring you inward towards-- maybe a little further south than you would have wanted to for optimal backdoor entrance into Whitestone, but it's about your only path.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have I walked this path before? I never walked this path at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have had no reason to walk this path. You've heard about it, you know of this side of the mountain range, but based on your history, there's no reason you would have come here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Whatever it takes to get to that back door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so we're aware of what your stealth rolls are with the Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You get ten? Oh. Well, I got a 40, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a pretty good spread. So you guys, you've hit the edge of the path. Are you heading up the rockslide trail?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You all, one by one, begin to climb over the trail and some rocks tumble loose beneath your feet, grasp. And you help each other get to the very top.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I use my Mage Hand to help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As he looks at the clock! "That's adorable."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you all eventually manage to make it over the top of the rockslide trail and eventually it leads you to where these two large mountains come together, and there is a small path that leads between. It winds and travels downward. You can see bits of the rock have fallen and crumbled, and there are small boulders and such that just, over time and through erosion, have tumbled down this ravine to start filling it with occasional chunks of stone. You begin walking through this ravine for another good 45 minutes to an hour, keeping a keen eye out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is this the same ravine that we're travelling across?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Basically, you guys have been traveling up the side of the coast. You've now turned inward over the mountain range to head down into the valley of Whitestone. You are currently just now heading up through the mountain range, inwards towards the mountain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this the river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no river here. It's just stone that comes together for a pathway in between. This is where two large peaks of the mountains basically come to join at the bottom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so we're not at the river.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the river is actually inside the valley and to the south of Whitestone. So pressing down I would like you all to roll a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, that's all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One, one, 20, 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As all of you guys are charging forward, both Vex and Vax, you hear this slight noise of a couple rocks (clattering) in the ravine behind you. You both turn and look and for a split second you swear you see between some of the rocks and paths of jagged stone that mark the walls of this ravine, you see a quick blur of blue that vanishes behind a higher platform above you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Smurfs!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A blur of blue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A large blur of blue just disappears behind one of the outcroppings that's blocking your view of higher up the ravine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shushes) Down. Hide.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I cast Stoneskin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stealth.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I fasten my Cloak of Displacement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I prepare--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys prepare for a second, and as you're all paying attention, you guys also see another shift of blue (whoosh) go across the way. And this time you see it's something large and blue that moves across the stone and goes into a small cavern that looks about 25 feet up the way that's just past your visual range from this low in the ravine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have any visual on what it could be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It wasn't a giant snake. There was something attached to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth. (louder) And I whisper, but for sake of microphones, do you know of a creature that's blue, and fast, and is kind of snakey but has arms and legs?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me think about it for a second. Do I know a creature that's blue and snakey?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It sounds like basilisks, but they're too slow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. Ooh, that's 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. You've heard of various lizard-like creatures that grow to large sizes. Usually those fall into the realm of dragons and such. The color blue, though, is uncommon, unless it were a blue dragon. However, the motion of this creature does not seem to necessarily be the territory of a blue dragon. It's hard to point exactly what this is, but you do know it's probably something in the serpentine-type magical realm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would I know it from the description? Just from my local knowledge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a history check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The blue thing's weird. The blue thing is what's throwing me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine. Unfortunately, nothing of this type has come across you. If it has, it's been too long, and you've forgotten it. There are a number of dangerous things that exist in these mountains.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got a really good idea. Wait. No! Grog, pick up something really heavy, and throw it as far as you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go over and I grab Scanlan--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A boulder or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put Scanlan down. Find a large rock that's tumbled down, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're really heavy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I discus the thing and (whoosh).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that was great. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks down. Looks down at the rest of you. Rears back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It saw us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Didn't see me.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, of course it saw us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With 37 stealth, yo. It saw us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it didn't seem to give a shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just withdrew over the edge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we run?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe just move really fast away from him

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then we can haul ass really fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will it move with us, your shell?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, as long as you stay close to me. It moves with me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, fuck this thing. Let's get out of here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! I cast Anti-Life Shell. Stay close!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you begin casting and finish the spell. As the sphere appears-- at which point you now see a large blue blur (whoosh) dart off of the cliffside into the air (impact noise) and skidding right in front of you guys, blocking off the side of the ravine you guys were running towards. You can now see it: a huge, elongated, serpentine body covered in blue scales and horns. You can see what looks to be six to eight arms and a series of legs all across its long, snakelike torso. As it looks it snarls at you all (snarls). And you see sparks of energy, electricity (sparking noises) in its jaw. (growls, roars)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Salamander?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we're going it end tonight! (yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez Louise!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't do that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can, because it's 10:30.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's not. It's like 8:45.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We can keep going if you guys want to stay long. It's Thursday night.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: I'm coming to you with my laptop before you continue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who's that guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (loud reactions)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the fuck? It's got so many arms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a kobold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [end of transcript]
